sentences.sContent: You might not even be able to come to church on Sabbath morning.
sentences.sContent_eng: You might not even be able to come to church on Sabbath morning.
sentences.sCn: 或许你们也没法在安息日的早晨来教堂做礼拜。

sentences.sContent: When does Sabbath begin on the moon, where the sun sets once a month?
sentences.sContent_eng: When does Sabbath begin on the moon, where the sun sets once a month?
sentences.sCn: 在一个月日落一次的时候,什么时候才是由月亮开始的安息日?

sentences.sContent: Holier than these days is the Sabbath, which is demarcated by even further rules and observances.
sentences.sContent_eng: Holier than these days is the Sabbath, which is demarcated by even further rules and observances.
sentences.sCn: 比这些日子更神圣的，是安息日，它被更加严格的规则和规定区分开来。

trans.tranOther: to obey or not obey the religious rules of the Sabbath
